groups.title: Welcome to Your Systemized Selling Playbook
groups.description: This playbook is designed to pull you out of your “industry box” and “company box,” forcing you to view your business through the lens of a Brand Marketer and Sales Strategist. Working IN your playbook is your time to step back and work ON the strategic growth of your business.

groups.title: How to Use This Playbook
groups.description: Dedicate at least one hour per week to working in your playbook. Its purpose is not to provide all the answers but to guide you in asking the right questions and focusing on your business like a marketing and sales strategist.

groups.title: 6-Session Program Overview
checkboxes: Session 3: Engagement Strategy - Lead Magnet & Initial Outreach
Session 4: Engagement Strategy - Conversion Funnel Strategy
Session 5: Sales Process - Pre-Qual, Uncover Pain, & Collaborate
Session 6: Sales Process - Storytelling, Proposal, Close, & Follow-up

groups.title: Brands Are a Direct Reflection of Their Founder
groups.description: While you may offer similar services to your top competitors, your (1) core expertise, (2) passion for what you do, and (3) your “Why”—why you’re in business and why people should choose you—are as unique as your fingerprint. As a result, the foundation of your differentiation and brand will be built around the very best of you.

groups.title: Prepare for Your Kick Off Session
groups.description: Before your kick-off session, take a moment to complete the three prompts below. During the session, you’ll share your Core Expertise, Passion, and Why with your mastermind team as part of your introduction.
questions: Define your core expertise.
Describe your PASSION for what you do.
Describe your WHY for being in business.

groups.title: Niching Strategy
groups.description: Lead generation and sales success start with understanding your audience. Our Niching Strategy is designed to help you craft the right message for the right audience. This begins by clearly defining your audience and gaining a deep understanding of their pain points and needs.

groups.title: Primary Target Audience
checkboxes: They clearly value you and your product or service.
They benefit most from the value you provide.
They are the most profitable client for your business.
questions: Describe your Primary Audience.
Primary Audience’s Pain Points.

groups.title: Secondary Target Audience
groups.description: This audience is highly valuable, though secondary to your Primary Audience.
questions: Describe your Secondary Audience.
Secondary Audience’s Pain Points.

groups.title: Tertiary Target Audience
questions: Describe your Tertiary Audience.
Tertiary Audience’s Pain Points.

groups.title: Disqualified Audiences(s)
questions: Describe audience(s) that you will not work with and describe why.

groups.title: Additional Target Audience Information
questions: Define Demographics, Geographics, Psychographics, Industry(s), etc.
Audience research: market size, needs, behaviors, etc.

groups.title: How Are You Different
groups.description: The key to this module lies in the final prompt: how effectively you identify opportunities to differentiate your services. Differentiation doesn’t require saying something entirely unique; it’s about emphasizing what you are known for. Consider Volvo: while nearly all car brands promote safety, Volvo is distinctly recognized as the “safety car.”
questions: Analyze your competitors - document their strengths, weaknesses, positioning, etc.
Document competitive services.
Document competitors pricing.
Identify opportunities to differentiate your offering.

groups.title: Create Your Differentiation Statement
questions: What’s missing in your industry? (Hint: Your answer should connect to your “Why”—the driving purpose behind starting your business.)
Tie in how your experience and passion can fill in the industry gaps.
Create your Differentiation Statement. (One sentence that defines your differentiation.)

groups.title: Reduce Your Statement to 5 Words
questions: Word or Phrase 1
Word or Phrase 2
Word or Phrase 3
Word or Phrase 4
Word or Phrase 5
Give your service a name.

groups.title: Concisely Define Your Service
questions: Define your service as clearly as possible and in as much detail as possible.
Describe the benefits your clients will enjoy from your service.
Define ways that you can offer a recurring revenue model.

groups.title: Price Plays a Role in Every Purchasing Decision
questions: Define fixed and variable costs involved with producing your service.
Identify your pricing model (hourly, program-specific, etc.).
Define how your pricing compares to the competitive options available.

groups.title: Positioning You in Your Prospects Subconscious Mind
questions: Point #1: Identify your first word, idea, or phase to promote your differentiation.
How does this topic promote your differentiation and educate your audience?
Point #2: Identify your second word, idea, or phase to promote your differentiation.
How does this topic promote your differentiation and educate your audience?
Point #3: Identify your third word, idea, or phase to promote your differentiation.
How does this topic promote your differentiation and educate your audience?
Point #4: Identify your fourth word, idea, or phase to promote your differentiation.
How does this topic promote your differentiation and educate your audience?
Point #5: Identify your fifth word, idea, or phase to promote your differentiation.
How does this topic promote your differentiation and educate your audience?

sessions.title: Engagement Strategy - Lead Magnet & Initial Outreach

groups.title: Step 1 Lead Magnet
questions: Define your Lead Magnet or Lead Magnet Options

groups.title: Step 2 Initial Hmm Message
questions: Define Audience by Titles
Define Pains or Needs
Define Differentiators
Write your Initial ’Hmm’ Message-A for testing
Write your Initial ’Hmm’ Message-B for testing
Write your Initial ’Hmm’ Message-C for testing
Write your Initial ’Hmm’ Message-D for testing

groups.title: Step 3 Conversation Strategy
questions: Define the particulars of your lead magnet.
Add an urgency.
Write your Conversation Strategy Template Message.

groups.title: Step 4 Conversion Funnel
questions: List events that you can offer.
Next Free Offer
Initial Paid Offer
The Big Sale

groups.title: Lead Magnet to Conversion Funnel Transition
questions: Describe how you will introduce your Conversion Funnel from your Lead Magnet.
Document your Lead Magnet follow up plan.

sessions.title: Sales Process - Pre-Qual, Uncover Pain, & Collaborate

groups.title: Practice 1: Pre Qualification
questions: List questions to identify your Primary, Secondary, or Tertiary Audience as defined in Module 2.

groups.title: Practice 2: Uncover Pain
questions: Define Pain Point # 1
Define Pain Point # 2
Define Pain Point # 3

groups.title: Practice 3: Collaboration
questions: Define multiple service options to present to your prospects.
Define the upside and downside of service option 1
Define the upside and downside of service option 2
Define the upside and downside of service option 3
Define the ballpark range for service option 1
Define the ballpark range for service option 2
Define the ballpark range for service option 3

sessions.title: Sales Process - Storytelling, Proposal, Close, & Follow-up

groups.title: Practice 4: Tell Your Story
questions: How you got here
Why you got here
Identify the Pain
Personalize the Solution
Define Your Differentiation
